page.title: 14ALTRINCHAM MARKET
page.content: 67 STALL HOLDERS WERE INTERVIEWED ON JUNE 23 1985.DURING OUR INTERVIEWS WE DISCOVERED THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION : THE MAJORITY OF STALL HOLDERS HAD BEEN TRADING FOR OVER 5 YEARS AND SOME FOR AS LONG AS 20 YEARS. GOODS ARE TRANSPORTED TO ALTRINCHAM BY VAN OR CAR. A FEW STALL HOLDERS KEEP THEIR GOODS AT A LOCK UP NEAR THE MARKET. ONE PERSON TRANSPORTS HIS GOODS BY HORSE & CART! THE MARKET STARTS TRADING AT ABOUT 7.30 A.M. AND SOME STALLHOLDERS ARRIVE AS EARLY AS 5 A.M. TRADING STOPS AT 4.30 P.M.AND THE MARKET IS PACKED UP. THE MAIN MARKET DAYS ARE TUESDAY AND SATURDAY, BUT THERE IS A SMALL FOOD MARKET ON FRIDAY. THE MARKET CUSTOMERS INTERVIEWED WERE PLEASED WITH THE QUALITY OF GOODS FOUND ON THE MARKET AND THE FRIENDLINESS OF THE TRADERS.
